thread.title: O’Reilly Critical Of Trump Administration’s Lack of Discipline
thread.title_full: O’Reilly Critical Of Trump Administration’s Lack of Discipline

author: Charles Campbell
title: O’Reilly Critical Of Trump Administration’s Lack of Discipline
text:
Reports Say Trump Has Decided On New National Security Adviser 
“Did Mrs. Conway mislead? Or did she not know the general was in trouble? Either way, not a good situation,” O’Reilly said. “It’s becoming clear that President Trump needs better coordination among his staff.” 
“No way Kellyanne Conway should be out saying all’s fine with Gen. Flynn when all was not fine,” he added. “That kind of confusion doesn’t do anyone in this country any good, especially because President Trump has legions of people trying to hurt him.” Advertisement - story continues below 
O’Reilly warned how TV appearances were beginning to hurt the Trump administration, and suggested that if they were going to appear on TV, the staff needed to be more disciplined. 
He mentioned that for every news appearance, White House officials should prepare to be “attacked.” 
“What I don’t think the Trump administration is understanding is everything they say can and will be used against them,” O’Reilly said. 
His only exception was his network’s morning show Fox & Friends , jokingly adding, “They like [Trump] a little bit.” Advertisement - story continues below
